Choosing Our OKR Rollout Strategy

A visual guide to two effective paths for implementing Objectives & Key Results within P&T.

of highly aligned companies achieve above-average business growth. A clear OKR structure is key to that alignment.

Option 1: Tiering Across Company & P&T

This approach ensures immediate, direct alignment with overarching company goals from day one.

Company-Level OKRs
↓
P&T Owns Some L1 OKRs
↓
P&T Creates L2 OKRs

Benefit Analysis

This model visually represents P&T's work as a direct component of the larger company strategy, fostering a unified sense of purpose.

Option 2: Pilot Program within P&T

A focused pilot allows us to test, learn, and refine the OKR process on a smaller scale before a wider rollout.

P&T Senior Leader L1 OKRs
↓
Product Head L2 OKRs
↓
Team-Level L3 OKRs (Optional)

Benefit Analysis

This tiered internal structure ensures every level within P&T is connected, promoting focused execution during the pilot phase.

Recommendation & Proposed Timeline

Given this is our first implementation, **Option 2 (The P&T Pilot)** is the recommended path. It minimizes risk and allows us to build a strong foundation. Here is a potential timeline for this approach.

Phase 1

Define L1 OKRs

Senior P&T Leaders establish 2-3 high-level objectives.

Phase 2

Define L2 OKRs

Product Heads create supporting objectives that align with L1.

Phase 3

Review & Expand

Assess pilot success and plan for a broader company rollout.
